definition: to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]
to experience/to undergo/to pass through/all/each/every/history
old variant of 歷|历[li4]
calendar
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
blue-green or azure (of water)/vast (of water)/cold
old variant of 桑[sang1]
mulberry tree
surname Sang

sentences.english: Look at these dreams so beaten and so battered.
sentences.chinese: 看看这些历尽沧桑的梦想。

sentences.english: She has buffeted about from pillar to post for ten years.
We've been through a lot but we're still together. It must be fate.
sentences.chinese: 我们历尽沧桑后仍然在一起，必定是命中注定的。

sentences.english: Go through vicissitudes of life , your needing to learn to ignore over.
sentences.chinese: 历尽沧桑，你要学会忽略过去。

sentences.english: Some of the greatest faith heroes have been people who had the most broken lives and unworthiness.
sentences.chinese: 最伟大的属灵英雄往往是历尽沧桑，不配神重用的人。

sentences.english: Chinese literature has a very long history and has witnessed some turbulent times.
sentences.chinese: 中华文学实可谓源远流长，历尽沧桑。

sentences.english: Many small communities along the coast have seen good times and bad.
sentences.chinese: 许多沿海岸的小乡镇都曾历尽沧桑。

definition: having lived through many changes
weather-beaten/having experienced the hardships of life
great changes/ups and downs/vicissitudes/abbr. of 滄海桑田|沧海桑田[cang1 hai3 sang1 tian2]
to have experienced a lot of/to have been through
wind and frost/fig. hardships
a sense of having been through good times and bad/a weathered and worn look
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
lit. having crossed the vast ocean (idiom)/fig. widely experienced in the vicissitudes of life
to go through thick and thin (idiom)
having experienced much suffering
to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
kalpa (loanword) (Hinduism)
as time goes by (idiom)
affairs of life/things of the world
wind and rain/the elements/trials and hardships
doddering/senile
